text: this is kit Eaton for the New York Times
don't be fooled into thinking that black
friday sales are the best time to buy
something if you use an app like nifty
on your smartphone to be able to see the
prices of an item can fluctuate
throughout the year and you may be
better off waiting to buy that seemingly
bargain asst 43 inch flat screen TV
until different sale time arrives
Nifty's main trick is to monitor prices
for all sorts of goods in different
well-known stores you can either command
the app to search for an item you're
interested in buying or browse through
the apps catalog like collection of
deals that it's found online when you
found an item you're interested in
buying you tap on it and then you learn
more about the current deal including
being able to see the historic price of
the item to see if the current deal is
actually a good one or not you can then
tell nifty to track the item you're
interested in buying to see if its price
drops at which point the app will alert
you and then if you want for some stores
you can actually buy the item directly
on your phone stores like best buy
forever 21 and even etsy a part of
nifty's catalog and its interface makes
online shopping for deals quite a
pleasant experience but it's not all
perfect I found the app does have some
search glitches and though the app is
free it's only on iOS a great
alternative to nifty is shopsavvy which
is free for iOS Android and Windows
Phone devices the main part of the app
works a little differently to nifty it's
a barcode scanner so you could be
standing in the aisle of one shop see a
deal scan the code and find out via the
app if the price for that item is
actually a good one or not or if you can
get a better deal elsewhere shopsavvy
also has a curated sales sections a bit
like nifty's where it shows you in an
image heavy list views on all sorts of
items from stores like Walmart or fry's
electronics and if you've got an item in
mind like a galaxy s6 smartphone you can
even search shop savvy and find out if
there are any deals being offered on it
and just like nifty you can often by the
atom directly via the app itself via a
connection to a retailer's online store
my favorite part of shopsavvy is it's
bright and cheerful interface makes
online shopping a pleasant experience
and using both of these apps may be
preferable to shoving your way through a
crowd on a busy black friday shopping
morning and that's it from me happy
thanksgiving
